items.title: How to Start Global Investing with ₹800 | Fractional Shares Explained for Beginners
items.description:
Want to invest in top global stocks, but don’t have thousands to spare? Good news — with just ~$10, you can start building a global portfolio using fractional shares!
In this video, you’ll know What are fractional shares? How to start investing globally from India?Best Indian apps for U.S. stock investing? Step-by-step guide to buy fractional shares
Risks & benefits of global investingOpen the doors to global investing, diversify your portfolio, and take your first step towards financial freedom—starting with just ₹800. Whether you're a beginner or a side hustler looking to expand globally, this guide is for you.

items.title: Technical view: Nifty could hit 25,500 as long as it holds 24,700, Bank Nifty needs to sustain above 57,120 for target of 57,900
items.description: Technical view: Bank Nifty hit a fresh lifetime high of 57,000 today. Analysts say that the overall trend in the index remains firmly positive.

items.title: Taking Stock: Market extends gains for fourth day; Nifty at 8-month high
items.description: The record run of Nifty Bank index continued, with index hitting 57,049.50, ending 0.5 percent higher, while other sectoral indices, barring realty, ended in the green with IT, oil & gas, power, PSU Bank up 1 percent each.

items.title: PSU Bank index jumps 2% amid RBI's liquidity boost; BoI, BoM, Indian Bank rise up to 4%
items.description: PSU Bank stocks: Bank of India shares jumped nearly 4 percent to trade at Rs 129 apiece, while those of Bank of Maharashtra gained over 3 percent to hover around Rs 57 apiece.

items.title: Live: Nifty surges for 4th straight day, embarks above 25,100 | Closing Bell
items.description: Sensex, Nifty Extend Rally To 4th Day. Nifty Embarks Above 25,100-mark, 8-month High. PSU Banks, IT Stocks Lead Rally. IT Stocks Shine On Strong US Jobs Report. RBI Policy Boost Continues To Drive Banks. Realty Stocks See Profit-booking. Nifty Smallcap Rises for Sixth Day. Nifty Midcap Surges For Fourth Day. Nifty 50 Gainers: Jio Financial, Kotak Mah, Bajaj Finance. Nifty 50 Losers: Eternal, ICICI Bank, M&M. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: SEBI allows clearing corps to adjust core SGF from currency to equity derivatives
items.description: The SEBI approval of one-time transfer of excess core SGF from currency segment to the equity derivatives segment was helpful for clearing corporations. Otherwise, they had to contribute it additionally

items.title: Wipro block deal: Around 2% equity exchanged for Rs 5,057 crore, stock gains
items.description: Around 20.23 crore shares of Wipro, which is around two percent of equity, worth Rs 5,057.5 crore exchanged hands on the bourses

items.title: Data Patterns, Cochin Shipyard, Zen Technologies shares see profit booking after tearaway rally in last one month
items.description: Select defence shares saw profit booking on June 9 after a tearaway rally witnessed in them in the past one month.

items.title: Rapido sets sight on food deliveries at lower commission, sending shares of Swiggy, Eternal lower
items.description: Rapido has begun onboarding restaurants for the pilot project and is charging a flat commission rate of Rs 25 on all orders below Rs 400, and Rs 50 for orders worth more than Rs 400, as per reports.

items.title: Buy PNC Infratech; target of Rs 386: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on PNC Infratech has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 386 in its research report dated June 09, 2025.

items.title: PowerGrid: Moderate quarter, but project pipeline strong
items.description: Outlook looks good on the back of capex plans and diversification drive

items.title: Realty stocks in red amid profit booking after massive gains following RBI's jumbo rate cut
items.description: Real Estate Stocks: Nifty Realty was marginally down in the red to hover around 1,038 in the morning, snapping a two-day gaining streak.

items.title: MCX shares rise 7% to hit all-time high as firm gets SEBI's nod to launch electricity derivatives
items.description: MCX share price: The stock has risen over 16% in the past five days, and has jumped over 39% in the past one month.

items.title: Dalmia Bharat, Nuvoco, Star Cement, others fear business hit as West Bengal revokes incentives
items.description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's government had passed the revocation of incentive schemes in March this year, which could likely impact cement makers adversely, some industry players have said.

items.title: Chart of the Day: Is rising market activity signalling a trap?
items.description: While stock prices grab headlines, it's market volume—especially Average Daily Turnover (ADT)—that often tells the real story. A surge in volume without a breakout could be a warning sign, not a bullish signal.

items.title: Capri Global shares soar over 11 percent after large trade, NBFC offers 'Auto Pay' on gold loans
items.description: Capri Global has also strengthened its digital services with a 'Smart Auto Pay' facility for gold loans, which it said is designed to make gold loan repayments more convenient and hassle-free.

items.title: L&T Secures 'Significant' Order Worth Rs 1,000-2,500 crore for Maharashtra PSP Project from JSW Energy
items.description: L&T Secures Significant Order for Maharashtra PSP Project

items.title: Info Edge India Shares Rise by 2.18% in Today's Trading Session
items.description: With Info Edge India last traded price at Rs 1540.00, the stock reflects a positive trend, supported by its strong financial performance and market sentiment.

items.title: Ola Electric Mobility Shares Rise Over 2% Amidst Market Fluctuations
items.description: The stock’s movement will likely be influenced by upcoming financial results and broader market conditions.

items.title: Hyundai Motor India shares clock best day in 11 weeks to gain over 7 percent: Here are the likely triggers
items.description: Hyundai India share price: Kotak Institutional Equities maintained a 'Buy' rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 2,050 per share. This implies an upside potential of over 10% from the stock's previous closing price.

items.title: Motherson Sumi Wiring India Shares Rise by 2.21% in Today's Trading
items.description: With shares trading at Rs 61.85, Motherson Sumi Wiring India has demonstrated a positive movement of 2.21% in today's session, reflecting an optimistic investor outlook amid recent financial performance data.
